headline: Ohio Gov. Mike DeWine tests positive for COVID-19 after experiencing mild symptoms
author: Emily Sanderson
sentences:
— Governor Mike DeWine (@GovMikeDeWine) April 15, 2022
The governor is in quarantine following Centers for Disease Control and Prevention protocol.
The governor had a runny nose, headache, body aches and a sore throat and was diagnosed with COVID-19 by his personal physician.
Mike DeWine has tested positive for COVID-19 after experiencing mild symptoms, his office announced in a statement on Twitter.
You may be able to find the same content in another format, or you may be able to find more information, at their web site.
Both the governor and first lady are fully vaccinated, each having received the two-dose vaccination and a booster shot.
Governor DeWine has been experiencing mild symptoms such as a runny nose, headache, body aches, and a sore throat.
Today, Ohio Governor Mike DeWine announced that he has been diagnosed with COVID-19 by his personal physician.
First Lady Fran DeWine is experiencing no symptoms and has tested negative, his office stated.
This content is imported from Twitter.
